As surviving hostages are released, Israel celebrates Trump as a hero
subhead: Hamas handed over the last 20 living hostages to Israeli authorities on Monday morning. The American president was to address Israel's parliament at midday.

title: Sarkozy learns start date of prison term, details not made public
subhead: The former French president was informed of when and where he will serve his prison sentence for his conviction of criminal conspiracy in the Libyan campaign financing case.

title: Macron blames parties for destabilizing PM as budget showdown looms
subhead: 'Many of those who have fueled division and speculation have not risen to the moment,' the French president said upon his arrival in Egypt on Monday, where he is attending the Gaza summit.

title: Economics Nobel awarded to trio for work on innovation-driven growth
subhead: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt were presented with the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for their work on a key economic concept known as 'creative destruction.'

title: New French cabinet shows Macron is still calling shots
subhead: Unveiled Sunday night, the new government led by reappointed Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu faces two-confidence votes this week and must push through a budget before year's end.

title: 'One Battle After Another' stirs political passion in the US
subhead: Lauded as a 'rallying cry' by some and denounced as 'glorifying terrorism' by others, the film has been dissected in starkly opposing terms, writes Le Monde's Thomas Sotinel in his column.

title: Paris's remarkable fashion week masks the luxury industry's headlong rush
subhead: By reigniting the dream machine, the so-called 'fashion week of the century' has signaled the rise of a new generation of designers – but without revealing anything about the intentions of the leaders of luxury conglomerates.
